report_title: Jewelry & Watch Wholesaling in the US
executive_summary: Wholesalers have encountered volatility because of unstable prices of precious metals. Precious metals are a critical input to products, and the weight of the precious metal that a piece of jewelry contains primarily determines its retail price. Any significant change in the prices of commodities, including gold, silver or platinum, strongly influences the industry because it affects both the cost and selling price of goods. Because of volatility in input costs, industry revenue has dropped at a CAGR of 3.1% to $54.5 billion over the past five years, including a 2.7% decline in 2023. Profit has also fallen to 3.1% of revenue in 2023 from 4.0% in 2018.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Uncertainty During the Economic Period Has Rocked Revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The price of gold comprises a large portion of the purchasing costs for wholesalers. With purchases representing a large percentage of revenue, profit margins remain low. Commodity prices reached an all-time high while supply remained low, drastically increasing product prices. The nonessential nature of products allows consumers to delay their purchases of expensive luxury items.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry Structure Remains the Same to a Large Extent
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Nonemployers account for the majority of industry establishments and typically serve their immediate geographical location. The number of wholesalers and facilities is nearly equal, indicating that the industry is fragmented. Wholesalers distribute jewelry and watches from domestic manufacturers and imported jewelry. Imports in the upstream Jewelry Manufacturing industry (IBISWorld report 33991) are crucial for wholesalers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: INPUT COSTS RISE, PUTTING PRESSURE ON PROFIT
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Silver, gold and platinum are essential raw materials for the industry. The price of these precious metals has grown and has put pressure on profit margins. Wholesalers have been unable to make meaningful cost savings because of the volatility in input costs throughout the period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: IMPROVING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS IS SET TO BOOST REVENUE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Improving economic conditions will result in growing consumer confidence, which benefits wholesalers. Expected rising disposable income levels and growth in consumer spending will contribute to revenue growth as consumers will feel more comfortable purchasing luxury items during improving economic periods.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: WHOLESALERS WILL TAKE ADVANTAGE OF INTERNATIONAL TRADE IN UPSTREAM INDUSTRIES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Steady import penetration will help revenue growth. Trade levels are associated with the manufacturing industries for jewelry and watches, but many wholesalers actively participate in trade by distributing foreign goods. When trade levels in manufacturing industries rise, wholesalers' role in distributing goods becomes more important in the jewelry and watch supply chain.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: PROFIT IS SET TO IMPROVE AS PRECIOUS METAL PRICES FALL
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The price of precious metals like gold and silver is expected to stabilize over the next five years. Stability in the price of gold will reduce some pressure on the industry's profit. The number of industry establishments is expected to decrease as wholesalers continue consolidating to gain market share and improve cost savings.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry wholesale fine jewelry, costume jewelry, watches, clocks, precious metals and metal flatware, precious and semiprecious stones, silverware and jewelers' findings. This industry does not include the wholesale of precious metal ores or flatware made of nonprecious metal.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

key_trends: Large-scale fluctuations in the price of precious metals have led to volatility for products like watches and fine jewelry. Since these products are considered nonessential, consumers delay their purchases of expensive luxury items during uncertain economic times.

Improving economic conditions over the next five years will benefit wholesalers. Rising disposable income levels and growing consumer confidence will boost revenue growth as consumers will feel more comfortable purchasing luxury items during improving economic periods.
No specific regulations affect the industry. Although, wholesalers that only sell to other businesses must obtain a wholesaler's license.
Several associations represent industry wholesalers. These associations host conferences, provide networking opportunities and educate members on industry trends and regulations.
Precious metals wholesaled include gold, silver and platinum. The prices of these metals have fluctuated considerably in recent years.

Mass merchandisers like Walmart and Costco have traditionally purchased costume jewelry from wholesalers. The addition of extensive fine jewelry departments has created even more business for mass merchandisers.
Coastal regions with large ports are attractive regions for wholesalers. These locations make it ideal for access to imported jewelry.
Providing an extensive product range within a subsegment offers a one-stop shop for retailers. Retailers prefer wholesalers that can supply a variety of different products.
Mass merchandisers, like Walmart, grant consumers higher buying power. Larger retailers have placed significant pricing pressures on wholesalers to maximize their retail profit.
The industry is fragmented as most wholesalers are nonemployers. Most wholesalers sell on a local or regional level.

Economic uncertainty in recent years has led to the rise in prices of precious metals, including gold and silver. Rising prices in precious metals increases purchasing costs for wholesalers since it is a crucial product input.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Wholesalers often trade industry-relevant items among themselves to manage inventory and respond to changes in downstream market conditions. The wholesaler market is the most significant portion of industry revenue. This segment also includes distributors that purchase industry items in bulk from other large wholesalers and then sell them in smaller quantities to downstream markets.

Independent jewelry retailers make up the second-largest market. This market includes many local jewelers and individual stores for large chains like Zales and Kay's. Mass merchandisers like Walmart and Costco will represent a large portion of retailers' revenue contributions. This segment has traditionally purchased costume jewelry from wholesalers, but the addition of extensive fine jewelry departments has created even more business from mass merchandisers. Department stores carry fine jewelry, and costume jewelry and nonjewelry retail stores (e.g., women's clothing stores) primarily have costume jewelry and fashion watches.

Many manufacturing and mining industries use industry-relevant products, including gold and diamonds, for their business operations. Diamonds are also used as a cutting tool because of their highly robust chemical composition.

This segment includes purchases made by local and federal government agencies, repair shops, and other purchasers of products provided by wholesalers. This market segment has remained stable and accounts for a small share of industry revenue.

Because of the slight decline in the retail market, an increasing number of wholesalers have reached out directly to end customers to gain sales through e-commerce websites. This segment has had little success over the last five years as consumers are hesitant to purchase big-ticket items online without seeing the goods in person.

products_and_services.product_description: Precious metals wholesaled by this segment include gold, silver and platinum.
This segment includes traditional jewelry, including rings, necklaces, earrings and bracelets made from diamonds.
This segment includes a range of products, from mass-market watches under $100.00 to exclusive watches that cost more than $10,000.00.
Silverware and plated jewelry include silver-plated items, gold-plated items and other such products as a part of this segment.

tier_1_suppliers: Iron Ore Mining in the US
Mineral & Phosphate Mining in the US
Navigational Instrument Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Copper, Nickel, Lead & Zinc Mining in the US
Gold & Silver Ore Mining in the US
tier_2_buyers: Women's Clothing Stores in the US
Warehouse Clubs & Supercenters in the US
Direct Selling Companies in the US
Men's Clothing Stores in the US
Arts, Entertainment and Recreation in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: PRECIOUS METALS GROW AND CONTINUE TO BE THE LARGEST PRODUCT OFFERING
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Precious metals wholesaled by this segment include gold, silver and platinum. The prices of these metals have fluctuated considerably in recent years, causing volatility in revenue generated by this segment. Jewelry made from these metals is encrusted with gemstones and diamonds, so a change in their price influences consumer purchasing

demand_determinants.determinant_title: PRECIOUS METAL JEWELRY SHINES DURING ECONOMIC UNCERTAINTY
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Products include precious metal coins, gold and silver rings, earrings, bracelets and necklaces, platinum rings and other platinum jewelry encrusted with precious stones. During times of economic uncertainty, the price of precious metals rises.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: DIAMONDS AND DIAMOND JEWELRY SHRINK, BUT REMAIN A SHINING PART OF THE INDUSTRY
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Diamonds and diamond jewelry are the second-largest product segment. This segment includes traditional jewelry, including rings, necklaces, earrings and bracelets made from diamonds. Purchases of fine jewelry have slowed as economic activity was negatively affected by the pandemic and current record-high inflation has made people less comfortable purchasing luxury items like jewelry. Bridal jewelry keeps sales volumes of diamond jewelry consistent because bridal jewelry, including engagement rings, bridal sets and wedding bands, is considered inelastic.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: WATCHES, CLOCKS AND SPARE PARTS LOSE THEIR VALUE
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This segment includes a range of products, from mass-market watches under $100.00 to exclusive watches that cost more than $10,000.00. The greater use of mobile phones with built-in clocks has shrunk this segment. Consumers of fine jewelry that spend on high-end watches will not switch to inexpensive substitutes because they are more comfortable with their financial situations.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: COSTUME JEWELRY IS A STABLE PRODUCT SEGMENT IN THE INDUSTRY
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Since fine jewelry is much more expensive, people have chosen to match their clothes with semiprecious and costume jewelry. Consumers continue to buy costume jewelry to meet fashion trends and to keep up with fast fashion.
Products in this segment include emeralds, topaz, sapphire, tiger's eye, rubies and synthetic and freshwater pearls. These products are popular because of their use in costume jewelry.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: SILVERWARE AND OTHER PRODUCTS AND SERVICES STAY STEADY
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Gold, in its pure form, is a very soft and malleable metal, which is why pure gold is barely used in manufacturing jewelry. Gold alloys are used instead, which are much harder and can retain their shape. Silverware and plated jewelry include silver-plated items, gold-plated items and other such products as a part of this segment. Additional products include copper and brass, minerals and trophies. Repair work, handling charges and selling other complementary products, including jewelry polishing and maintenance goods, also make up this segment.

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic region has the country's highest concentration of jewelry and watch wholesalers. While New York is a strong retail center, it is also home to one of the largest ports in the United States, making it an ideal location for exporting or importing jewelry. The region also has the highest per capita income in the United States, giving the region an attractive income base for jewelry wholesalers to exploit.
The region holds the greatest concentration of jewelry retail stores. Being close to downstream retail markets makes the region attractive for wholesalers.

High concentration levels can be attributed to California, home to the second most jewelry and watch wholesalers. California holds some of the largest ports in the United States, making it an ideal location for jewelry wholesalers that want access to Asian markets.

regulations_points.regulation_title: No specific regulations are affecting the industry
regulations_points.regulation_description: No specific regulations are affecting the Jewelry and Watch Wholesaling industry. Although, wholesalers that only sell to other businesses must obtain a wholesaler's license from the US Department of Revenue. Also, operators are subject to a variety of employment-related laws, including those related to occupational health and safety, wages and overtime.

In response to the rapid spread of COVID-19 in 2020, many governmental organizations across the world, including the United States, passed regulations. These restrictions included quarantines, shelter-in-place orders and business closures for nonessential businesses in an attempt to slow the spread of coronavirus. These regulations have subsided following the re-opening of the economy.

factors_decreased_barrier: Although the industry is becoming more reliant on computer technology, labor is required for daily operations and has always been needed to oversee orders and provide additional customer service.

basis_points.basis_title: Providing an extensive product range within a subsegment offers a one-stop shop for retailers.
basis_points.basis_description: Retailers prefer wholesalers that can supply a variety of different products.

basis_points.basis_title: Mass merchandisers, like Walmart, grant consumers higher buying power.
basis_points.basis_description: Larger retailers have placed significant pricing pressures on wholesalers to maximize their retail profit.

concentration_points.concentration_title: MOST BUSINESSES SUPPLY LOCAL RETAIL DEMAND
concentration_points.concentration_description: A majority of industry establishments are nonemployers. As a result, this contributes to keeping the industry fragmented since several companies can't dominate industry revenue.

concentration_points.concentration_title: THE INDUSTRY IS FRAGMENTED AND NO COMPANY DOMINATES THE MARKET SHARE
concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry is fragmented since most wholesalers are small nonemployers.

cost_structure_breakdown.cost_type: Other costs like insurance, security and freight

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are the most significant expense
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases account for 76.4% of revenue in 2023, slightly higher than 75.9% in 2018. This is typical of wholesale industries, as purchases of large amounts of stock are needed to resell to downstream markets. Purchase costs are also high because of the increased input costs, like the price of precious metals used for products.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Several other costs like insurance and security are critical
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wholesalers incur additional costs, including insurance, security and freight costs. These costs make up 13.1% of revenue in 2023, slightly rising from 12.8% in 2018.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages remain stable during the period
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are the second-highest expense, but they only account for 4.8% of revenue in 2023, remaining stable over the past five years. Warehouse operators do not require many workers for daily tasks, including storing, sorting and transporting goods. Advancements in technology, including inventory software and automated machinery, have resulted in the need for higher-skilled labor.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit shrinks as input costs rise
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, accounts for 3.1% of revenue in 2023, falling from 4.0% in 2018. The importance of efficient supply chain management is critical. An increase in costs can have severe effects on operations. Low returns result from a mature industry with high levels of competition from domestic and foreign companies. Wholesalers also contend with pressure from downstream retailers and consumers for lower-priced products. Products are heavily tied to the price of their input costs. The rising price of precious metals has cut into profit margins.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Although the industry is becoming more reliant on computer technology, labor is required for daily operations and has always been needed to oversee orders and provide additional customer service.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patent technologies
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations. A low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur, just that the likelihood of some innovation materializing as a threat is lower.
However, the concentration of technologies is high in this industry. This suggests that industry operators have exposure to potentially unforeseen areas of innovation.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The industry is sensitive to disposable income and consumer sentiment
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry is sensitive to changes in disposable income and consumer sentiment. This is because most products, like fine jewelry and precious metals, are considered luxury goods.
Fashion jewelry has been demanded even during tough economic times because of its inexpensive nature. Since fashion changes quickly, it has also helped sustain demand for an extended period.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Revenue is affected by commodity prices
volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue volatility is linked to commodity prices. Wholesalers charge a small markup from the underlying cost of the commodity they operate with.

FAQs.question: How does your company maintain a competitive edge in an industry with many competitors?
FAQs.answer: Jewelry and watch wholesalers maintain an edge over competitors by providing exemplary services to their customers, especially timely deliveries. This helps them maintain working relationship with their clients.

FAQs.question: How does your firm adjust its marketing during poor economic conditions?
FAQs.answer: Jewelry and watch wholesalers struggle during times of economic downturn, because the products they wholesale are nonessential items to consumers' everyday lives.

FAQs.question: Does your company have a viable strategy in place to grow sales, and if so, what is that strategy?
FAQs.answer: Many jewelry and watch wholesalers have started to place a greater emphasis on the sales of costume jewelry in recent years. By adding this product segment to their core offerings, some wholesalers have benefitted their businesses.

FAQs.question: How do you manage volatility in demand due to economic conditions or seasonality?
FAQs.answer: Jewelry and watch wholesalers manage increased demand during the holiday season and Valentine's Day by increasing their inventory and efficiently managing their delivery process. While revenue was impacted due to the pandemic, it also introduced a new trend of buying jewelry instead of experiences (travel).

FAQs.question: How does increased digitalization at the business level and the growing popularity of online shopping affect your financial performance?
FAQs.answer: Companies wholesale not only the jewelry and watches consumers purchase, but also the materials that are used to make them. This makes bypassing jewelry and watch wholesalers completely harder to do than other peripheral wholesale industries. Online shopping increased during 2020 because of stay-at-home orders.

FAQs.question: Does your company use RFID to optimize inventory management and improve efficiency?
FAQs.answer: The vast majority of jewelry and watch wholesalers use RFID technology to manage their inventory, because it is cost-efficient.

FAQs.question: What is your company policy on regulation compliance?
FAQs.answer: While jewelry and watch wholesalers handle precious metals, none of them are hazardous. However, wholesalers must assure they properly handle their items and not damage them before they reach the customer.

FAQs.question: How have you adjusted to new regulations in the past decade? How have compliance costs been handled?
FAQs.answer: Jewelry and watch wholesalers have faced little to no regulation in the past decade, allowing operators to enter and exit the industry freely.

FAQs.question: How does volatility in the value of the dollar affect demand and profit?
FAQs.answer: As the US dollar appreciates, imports of gold, silver and other precious metals tends to increase. This leads demand for industry services to increase.

FAQs.question: How has the volatility of input prices affected your purchase costs and selling prices over the past five years? Can you contrast this to 2020?
FAQs.answer: Input prices of the underlying products jewelry and watch wholesalers sell have been volatile over the five years, leading to a moderate amount of volatility in purchasing costs and pricing power for wholesalers during the period. Industry operators experienced increased volatility during 2020 amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

FAQs.question: How close is your business to your main customers? What can you do to reduce freight times? Were freight times increased during the COVID-19 pandemic?
FAQs.answer: It is important for wholesalers to be able to quickly and efficiently freight goods to their customers. Mass merchandisers aim to minimize their inventory stock and wholesalers in proximity are able to provide prompt delivery, benefiting from this trend.

FAQs.question: How do you pursue new additions to your product line? Do you monitor rising fashion trends to stay ahead of the curve?
FAQs.answer: It is important for wholesalers to have new products that are in line with fashion trends and retail demand.

FAQs.question: Are there inefficiencies in your stock management practices that can be eliminated? What new technology could you implement?
FAQs.answer: It is important for wholesalers to have sufficient stock, especially in the lead up to special occasions such as Christmas and Valentine's Day.

FAQs.question: Have direct-to-consumer online sales affected the performance of your operations? How have you worked to combat this trend?
FAQs.answer: As a result of the continued proliferation of services conducted online, some watch sellers have shifted their operations to direct-to-consumer models, which circumvent industry wholesalers. During 2020 amid stay at home orders, online sales increased.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor consumers' disposable income levels? Have you noticed a move toward higher-margin products as incomes have improved?
FAQs.answer: Consumers with less spending money tend to delay or cut back purchases of industry items. Others substitute lower-priced items as a way to curb spending. Subsequently, industry revenue and profit suffer. However, the opposite is true when per capita disposable income rises.

FAQs.question: How does a rise in the world price of gold affect your company? How do you take advantage of this opportunity?
FAQs.answer: When the cost of gold increases, input costs for products increase. Since it is viewed as more resilient and less risky than world currencies, many investors turned to gold during the global financial crisis.
